intro: Clinelymus glaucus subsp. coloratus, commonly known as the blue flax or colorado flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Clinelymus glaucus subsp. coloratus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
